Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, interior spotted with a dark-brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, faded in places, and containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.104)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36361) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36361)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 214 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13407 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
